doc.after: The two primary streams of Ottoman written literature are poetry and prose Poetry was by far the dominant stream Until the 19th century Ottoman prose did not contain any examples of fiction there were no counterparts to for instance the European romance short story or novel Analogue genres did exist though in both Turkish folk literature and in Divan poetry
